p: C. longa optimized the level of intrahepatic antioxidant molecules and reduced the production of lipid peroxidation against oxidative damage caused by alcohol [ 19, 33, 34, 39], drugs [ 17, 35, 37, 38, 48], MCD diet [ 39], pesticides [ 42, 43], heavy metals [ 40, 41], and iron [ 49]. The inhibition of intrahepatic cytochrome P450 2E1 (CYP2E1) by C. longa contributed to its antioxidant effects against alcohol-induced oxidative stress in C57BL/6 mice [ 33]. C. longa facilitated the reduction of Fe 3+ ion in male New Zealand rabbits [ 49], which could contribute to the protection of liver tissue from oxidative damage caused by excess iron, during iron overload-induced liver injury.
